info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 3:45PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
At 342 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Fairacres, moving southeast at 25 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible.
Brief blowing dust is also possible with outflow winds arriving ahead of the storm.
Locations impacted include... Las Cruces, NMSU Main Campus, Mesilla, Fairacres, Picacho, Corralitos, Southern New Mexico State Fairgrounds, and Mesilla Valley Bosque State Park.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 122 and 148. Interstate 25 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 11. Highway 70 in New Mexico between mile markers 150 and 154.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
